60 st round 11 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 5 st 10 times - 70 st round 12 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 6 st 10 times - 80 st round 13 - 15 3 rounds single_crochet in each st around - 80 st slip_stitch into next st fo leaving length of yarn main bridge using light grey yarn round 1 magic_ring work 6 single_crochet into ring - 6 st round 2 2 single_crochet in next st 6 times - 12 st round 3 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 6 times - 18 st round 4 1 round single_crochet in each st around - 18 st fo leaving length of yarn stitch the main bridge to top saucer section using dark grey yarn stitch ncc - 1701 on top saucer section add white starboard green port orange lights figure 8 multi-spectral sensor array and primary scan platform using white yarn round 1 magic_ring work 6 single_crochet into ring - 6 st round 2 2 single_crochet in next st 6 times - 12 st switch to light grey yarn round 3 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 6 times - 18 st 1 row 18 st fo leaving length of yarn stitch bottom sensor and platform to bottom saucer section figure 8 saucer section top and bottom halves using a long piece of light grey yarn stitch together the edges of the top and bottom halves of the saucer section stuffing it to shape figure 9 don t over stuff figure 9 stitch saucer sections together do not overstuff saucer section support pylon using light grey yarn round 1 chain 5 work single_crochet in 4th chain single_crochet in next 2 st work 3 single_crochet in 1st chain single_crochet in next 2 st work 2 single_crochet in 4th chain round 2-10 4 rounds single_crochet in each st around - 10 st fo leaving length of yarn stitch the closed section of the saucer section support pylon to the back of the saucer section figure 10 figure 10 saucer section and support pylon feed the 6 wire through the front of the core figure 11 slide the wire through the open end of the support pylon and push the wire into the saucer section stitch the support pylon to the core with the extra yarn from the pylon figure 11 feed the wire through the front of the core the final product figure 12 figure 13 thank you for trying out my pattern i hope you had fun live long and prosper
